intro: Hieracium leptolenum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium leptolenum is often found in temperate climates and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
